posts.post_content: How did this card get so expensive? It's not even the best equipment in the block, hell, it isn't even the 3rd best equipment in the block with ([Skull Clamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skull Clamp), [Lightning Grieves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Grieves), and [Cranial Plating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cranial Plating) are all better all around equipments. And in my Red Akroma deck, [Fireshrieker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fireshrieker) and [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak) are also superior so that makes possibly 4 or 5 better (all of those mentioned above are common or uncommon), and we can't forget Sword of Light and Shadow that gives PROTECTION FROM 90% OF ALL TARGETED REMOVAL IN ANY FORMAT! (fire and ice does not save you from Plow, Terror, Putrefy, Vindicate, Condemn, and all the other major targeted removal spells that are mainly white and/or black; NOT blue or red (yeah, there's lightning bolt, but you can bolt a creature in response to equip so it doesn't' really matter). Don't get me wrong, Sword of Fire and Ice is a great equipment, it's just not ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: This card equipped on mirran crusader is nuts. You end up with a 4/4 creature with double strike and protection from green, black, red, and blue. This makes him only blockable by artifacts and white creatures. If he hits, he will do 8 damage, then 2 damage to two targets or 4 damage to one, and then draw you two cards. Put a Spirit mantle on him and he swings for 14 every turn and is unblockable.

Posted By: EverJohnny (5/17/2011 10:35:35 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Johnb86 - this is *easily* the best sword, not because of the protection effects, but because of the combat damage triggers. With every time you damage a player you get a burn spell and a card. That's the ultimate in card advantage - you could come out from a combat step ahead in life, ahead in creatures, and ahead in cards all in one swoop. And that's very, very repeatable - you can just keep using the burn to blast away blockers. If you aim that two damage at the player instead it's like this sword was giving +4/+2 rather than +2/+2.  
  
Put on a single creature that gets through, you're dealing +2 damage to the player, 2 damage anywhere you want, and drawing a card every turn. That's absolutely backbreaking. The only sword whose effect really rivals this guy is Feast and Famine's land-untapping effect.
posts.html:
@Johnb86 - this is easily the best sword, not because of the protection effects, but because of the combat damage triggers. With every time you damage a player you get a burn spell and a card. That's the ultimate in card advantage - you could come out from a combat step ahead in life, ahead in creatures, and ahead in cards all in one swoop. And that's very, very repeatable - you can just keep using the burn to blast away blockers. If you aim that two damage at the player instead it's like this sword was giving +4/+2 rather than +2/+2.

Put on a single creature that gets through, you're dealing +2 damage to the player, 2 damage anywhere you want, and drawing a card every turn. That's absolutely backbreaking. The only sword whose effect really rivals this guy is Feast and Famine's land-untapping effect.
